executive_summary: This Request for Quotation (RFQ) from the Federal Highway Administration (FHWA) seeks proposals for Microsoft (MS) 365 Project Suite (MS365) Support. The primary objective is to provide full life cycle support, including configuration, implementation, training, and ongoing administration of MS Project Online and Project for the Web. Key deliverables include a comprehensive project plan, OA workspace configuration, training materials, and project reporting. The FHWA will evaluate proposals based on Technical Approach, Corporate Experience, Staffing Approach, and Price, with non-price factors being more important than price. Critical success factors include demonstrating a strong understanding of MS365 Project Suite, relevant experience, a well-defined staffing plan, and a competitive price. To succeed, the response should emphasize a clear technical approach aligned with DOT requirements, highlight relevant corporate experience in MS365 support, present a qualified team, and offer a competitive pricing structure. The proposal should address the DOT's need for a robust and customized MS365 environment, including the transition from Project Online to Project for the Web. The response should also demonstrate an understanding of the DOT's security regulations and the importance of compliance with Section 508 standards for ICT accessibility.

submission_structure.description: Addresses the technical aspects of the requirement only.  Does not include cost or pricing information.
content_requirements: Cover Letter and Table of Contents

subsection_details.subsection: Cover Letter and Table of Contents
content_requirements: Company name, address, CAGE, Unique Entity Identifier, and TIN
Offeror’s point of contact information (name, address. phone number, and email address)
Sub-contractors or teaming partners that conduct at least 20% of the overall proposed work must be listed to include their DUNS/Unique Entity Identifier and TIN

subsection_details.description: Describes the overall technical approach and strategy for completing activities/projects performed in full life cycle support required for this effort.
content_requirements: Overall technical approach and strategy for completing activities/projects performed in full life cycle support

subsection_details.description: Describes recent and relevant corporate experience performing work similar in size and complexity to the activities and objectives described in Statement of Work (SOW).
content_requirements: Name and Unique Entity Identifier number (formerly known as DUNS #) of the Contractor performing the contract/order
Government organization or company that issued the contract
A brief description of the work performed on the contract/order
A discussion of how the contract is similar to the scope of the SOW
The name, title, and contact information for a point of contact whom the Government may contact if it desires additional information.

subsection_details.description: Details the approach for staffing the appropriate personnel to oversee the performance requirements. Resumes for all proposed personnel should be included.
content_requirements: Approach for staffing the appropriate personnel

submission_structure.description: Submit pricing in the format of the Schedule of Service, Contract Line Item Number (CLIN) Structure table (chart) shown in Part II.
content_requirements: Pricing in the format of the Schedule of Service, Contract Line Item Number (CLIN) Structure table (chart) shown in Part II.

submission_structure.description: Mandatory business information regarding your company in the body of the cover email message.
content_requirements: Confirmation your company accepts government task orders
Business Size (Small, Woman-Owned, Disadvantaged, Hub-Zone, Large, Non- Profit, etc.)
Verification company information listed in the System for Award Management (SAM) current and accurate?

response_format.page_limit_technical_quote: 10 pages (excluding cover letter, table of contents, and resumes)
response_format.email_size_limit: SINGLE email whose size shall not exceed 10 Megabytes
response_format.templates: Follow the CLIN chart in Part II for pricing. Adhere to the structure outlined in Submission Structure.
response_format.naming_conventions: Not specified, but use clear and descriptive file names.
response_format.font: Not specified, but use a readable font size (e.g., 11 or 12 point) and font type (e.g., Times New Roman or Arial).
response_format.margins: Not specified, but use standard margins (e.g., 1 inch on all sides).

factors.weight: More important than Corporate Experience and Staffing Approach
factors.description: The extent to which the quotation addresses the objectives identified in the SOW (Part III). Quotes will be reviewed and assessed in the context of meeting the Task Requirements identified in Part III, Section 4 of the SOW. The Offeror's approach to providing the support services identified in SOW, Section 4 will also be assessed for comprehensiveness and effectiveness.

Examples of corporate experience providing services similar in size and complexity to the requirements of the solicitation to determine whether they are recent and relevant. Government will be looking for recent and relevant experience in providing MS365 support services and evidence of the ability to provide the deliverables identified in Part III, SOW Section 6. “Recent” is defined as relevant experience performed anytime within 3-years from the date of the issuance of this RFQ. “Relevant” experience is defined as experience working on projects that involved MS365 requirements similar to those described in the SOW, and where the offeror facilitated meetings and communicated status and progress of the completion of tasks and requirements.
Whether the staffing approach is acceptable to meet the technical requirements of the solicitation.

The total quoted price of performing the requirements of the solicitation. The Government will evaluate quoted prices as a criterion under a Best Value source selection approach to determine the best-value for the Government. The price quotation will be evaluated for consistency and arithmetic accuracy, and if any math errors are found, the Government will, through clarifications, ask the Offeror to resolve any math errors. The Government will evaluate the Offeror’s total quoted price to determine if the price is fair and reasonable. The Government will evaluate price for reasonableness in accordance with one or more price analysis techniques identified in FAR Part 15.404-1(b).
adjectival_ratings: Not explicitly rated, but evaluated for reasonableness.

evaluation_criteria.best_value: Award will be made using the Best Value evaluation method utilizing the non-price related factors noted above. The government will evaluate the proposed price for reasonableness. All evaluation factors other than price, when combined, are more important to price.

timeline.submission_date: Not specified, but the RFQ document should contain this information.
timeline.questions_due: Not specified, but the RFQ document should contain this information.
timeline.presentations: The Government reserves the right to enter into exchanges with all Offerors, if it is in the best interest of the Government; however, the Government anticipates selecting the best-suited quote from the initial quotes, without entering into exchanges with all Offerors.
timeline.decision_date: Not specified, but the RFQ document should contain this information.
internal_milestones: Review SOW and identify key requirements.
Develop a detailed project plan for response preparation.
Assign roles and responsibilities to team members.
Conduct internal reviews of all sections before submission.
Submit the response by the deadline.

focus_areas: Demonstrate a strong understanding of the DOT's MS365 environment and requirements.
Highlight relevant experience in MS365 configuration, implementation, and support.
Present a clear and concise technical approach.
Propose a qualified team with the required expertise.
Offer a competitive and reasonable price.
Address the transition from Project Online to Project for the Web.
differentiators: Specific experience with DOT or similar government agencies.
Proven track record of successful MS365 implementations.
pain_points: DOT's current MS365 environment is in an out-of-the-box state.
Need for a robust architecture and customized configuration.
Transition from Project Online to Project for the Web.
Ensuring compliance with security regulations and Section 508 standards.
win_themes: Providing a fully functional and configured MS365 Project Suite tenant.
Delivering a solution that matures with the future transition to Project for the Web.
Ensuring compliance with DOT's requirements and federal standards.

compliance_checklist: Current active registration in the System for Award Management (SAM).
Submission of Volume 1 - Technical Quote and Volume 2 – Price Quote.
Compliance with page limits for the Technical Quote (10 pages).
Inclusion of all required information in the Cover Letter.
Inclusion of all required information in the Organizational Information section (cover email).
Completion of the Corporate Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) Form (Attachment 4) if applicable.
Compliance with FAR and TAR clauses.
Compliance with Section 508 standards for ICT accessibility.
Adherence to all instructions and requirements outlined in the RFQ.
